result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Bongle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action, including buy money. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held 9/12/14

Defendant Steven D Bongle in court with attorney Erica Lynn Bauer. Defendant Steven D Bongle in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State defers to Defense. Court questions whether PSI would be needed if plea is taken, defers to Defense. Defense makes statement regarding Defendant's dissatisfaction with her services, moves to withdraw, advises Defendant wants to proceed pro se. Defendant is tired of waiting, wants to get case done. State advises that Defendant has been serving sentence after revocation. Court questions Defendant, who advises that release date in February, 2018. State advises of joint recommendation. Defense agrees. Defendant agrees, wants more sentence credit. Court explains sentence credit, questions Defendant on how he wants to proceed. Court questions Defense regarding motion to withdraw. Court questions Defendant, who was not satisfied with Ms. Bauer's representation. Defendant wants to take offer, just doesn't agree with his attorney. Court questions Defendant on whether he understands that State does not have to continue offer, will not allow Defendant to proceed without counsel. Defendant wants to keep Atty Bauer, wants to get these cases over with so he can get on with his programming. Court questions State, who is unsure if offer will remain on the table, advises that offer has been on the table for over 7 months. Defendant advises that Defense has had medical issues that have postponed cases. Court questions Defendant on whether he wants to proceed with Atty Bauer today. Defendant advises that he asked Atty Bauer to interview some witnesses and that never happened. Court continues questioning of Defendant, who wants to proceed with Atty Bauer. Court will not grant motion to withdraw. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant acknowledges repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
to Transport
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
from Atty Bauer withdrawing her motion to withdraw as counsel, asks court to set matter for plea/sentencing.
Various emails between JA Ripp and DA's office regarding scheduling.
for Withdrawal of Counsel by Atty Bauer
from Atty Bauer with Motion to Withdrawal of Counsel
from Atty Bauer asking to adjourn 7/10/14 hearing, hoping to resolve matter within next few weeks.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Steven D Bongle appears by video conference from Oshkosh Correctional along with attorney Erica L Bauer, who appears in person.  Defendant Steven D Bongle in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file Information early next week. Atty Bauer requests a status in 45 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven D Bongle
Current: P O Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional Institute, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2014)
Prior: C/o Door County Jail, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Attorney Erica L Bauer in court.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recalls the case as Atty Bauer is now present in court. Court advises defendant is concerned that Atty Bauer hasn't contacted him yet. Atty Bauer advises she's contacted the defendant within the last two month, was trying to get in touch with defendant last week but wasn't able to. Atty Bauer is not available 4/28/14. Court reschedules matter. Atty Bauer to let court know if matters are resolved so transport order can be done, otherwise defendant will appear by video conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven D Bongle appears by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises his JA tried to contact Atty Bauer by phone and received her answering machine. Defendant indicates he's not talked to his attorney yet, he's written several letters and received no response from Atty Bauer.  Court advises defendant if he's not satisfied with his counsel he should contact the Public Defenders office in Green Bay to see about getting new counsel appointed. Court reschedules matter.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Steven D Bongle in court, in custody.  Attorney Erica L. Bauer appeared by phone. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defense on whether she has discussed time limits.  Defense thought Defendant had been transferred to Dodge, hoped to discuss those matters with Defendant today but injured her back, requests adjournment. State has not made global offer. Defendant has been revoked, sentenced to prison. Atty Bauer will contact JA to schedule next appearance. Br. 2 case will track Br. 1 case.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/14/14 by jail staff.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Steven D Bongle in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Steven D Bongle in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Maciolek advises Atty Erica Bauer is representing defendant on another matter, he's sent Atty Bauer an email regarding taking this case but hasn't heard back from her.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Maciolek asks to adjourn matter until counsel is appointed. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
